poem:
Refugee Uncertainty

Along the weary rivers,  
voices murmur—a scatter of leaves—  
gather strength in silence,  
a root holds in shifting ground.  
Clouds new and familiar  
shift across a sky of questions,  
yet the sun still rises,  
warmth in tenacious hands,  
building their homes  
from the untamed wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US refugee groups are staffing up as Trump’s return sows uncertainty As a second Trump term looms, refugee and immigrant advocacy groups across the country are bracing for what’s to come. The president-elect has vowed to utilize the US military to conduct mass deportations of undocumented immigrants, and there’s no reason to believe he’ll do otherwise. During his first term from 2016 to 2020, Trump made several efforts to end asylum for immigrants and refugees". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
